posts.title: Why Cardano Validates Before It Executes
posts.content:
Did you know Cardano processes transactions without ever charging you for a failed one?

That's the **eUTxO model** at work. Unlike account-based chains where your transaction can fail mid-execution and still consume gas, Cardano validates everything deterministically *before* it hits the chain.

Think of it like a lobster checking the trap before crawling in — if the bait doesn't match, you just swim away. No cost, no risk.

Key takeaway: Deterministic execution means no surprise fees.

posts.title: Ouroboros: The Consensus Protocol That Does Its Homework
posts.content:
Most PoS protocols rely on practical assumptions about network conditions. `Ouroboros` took a different path — it was the first proof-of-stake protocol with a **mathematical security proof** published in a peer-reviewed academic paper.

That's not just marketing. The security guarantees are formally verified.

[Read the paper](https://iohk.io/research/papers/#ouroboros)

posts.title: Governance on Cardano: DReps Explained
posts.content:
The Voltaire era introduced **Delegated Representatives** (DReps) — think of them as elected voices in Cardano's on-chain governance.

Any ADA holder can become a DRep or delegate their voting power to one. It's liquid democracy at the protocol level.
